interpretable_name: Projected number of extreme heat days from 2040-60
indicator_source: Climate Change and Health Vulnerability Indicators: https://skylab.cdph.ca.gov/CCHVIz/
indicator_calculation_description: Data sourced from Climate Change and Health Vulnerability Indicators (https://skylab.cdph.ca.gov/CCHVIz/) based on global climate models from the CMIP5 archive developed by Scripps Institution of Oceanography and selected by Climate Action Team Research Working Group for research contributing to California’s Fourth Climate Change Assessment.
indicator_comments: These numbers are generated from models based on past data -- maybe these aren't useful to include, maybe we need something better like real-time data for heat?

indicator_calculation_description: Data sourced from Cal Enviro Screen 4.0 (https://oehha.ca.gov/calenviroscreen/report/calenviroscreen-40). Mean of summer months (May-October) of the daily maximum 8-hour ozone concentration (ppm), averaged over three years (2017 to 2019) from Air Monitoring Network, California Air Resources Board (CARB).
indicator_comments: Maybe this should go in the toxicants/pollutants category? Maybe we just incldue one of these (just raw value or percentile)

indicator_calculation_description: Data sourced from Cal Enviro Screen 4.0 (https://oehha.ca.gov/calenviroscreen/report/calenviroscreen-40). Mean of summer months (May-October) of the daily maximum 8-hour ozone concentration (ppm), averaged over three years (2017 to 2019) from Air Monitoring Network, California Air Resources Board (CARB). Percentile calculated relative to other census tracts.
indicator_comments: Maybe this should go in the toxicants/pollutants category? Maybe we just incldue one of these (just raw value or percentile)

indicator_calculation_description: Data sourced from Cal Enviro Screen 4.0 (https://oehha.ca.gov/calenviroscreen/report/calenviroscreen-40). The drinking water contaminant index is a combination of contaminant data that takes into account the relative concentrations of different contaminants and whether multiple contaminants are present in public drinking water systems and groundwater from 2011-2019. Sources of data include Safe Drinking Water Information System, EDT Library and Water Quality Analyses Data and California State Water Resources Control Board. See Cal Enviro Screen 4.0 report for more details.
indicator_comments: This indicator combines data from multiple toxicants such as nitrates, animal waste, perchlorate, arsenic, lead, Trichloropropane, Trihalomethanes etc. -- Maybe this should also go in the toxicant category?

indicator_calculation_description: Data sourced from Cal Enviro Screen 4.0 (https://oehha.ca.gov/calenviroscreen/report/calenviroscreen-40). The drinking water contaminant index is a combination of contaminant data that takes into account the relative concentrations of different contaminants and whether multiple contaminants are present in public drinking water systems and groundwater from 2011-2019. Percentile was calculated relative to other census tracts. Sources of data include Safe Drinking Water Information System, EDT Library and Water Quality Analyses Data and California State Water Resources Control Board. See Cal Enviro Screen 4.0 report for more details.
indicator_comments: This indicator combines data from multiple toxicants such as nitrates, animal waste, perchlorate, arsenic, lead, Trichloropropane, Trihalomethanes etc. -- Maybe this should also go in the toxicant category?

interpretable_name: Potential risk for lead exposure from housing
indicator_calculation_description: Data sourced from Cal Enviro Screen 4.0 (https://oehha.ca.gov/calenviroscreen/report/calenviroscreen-40). Percentage of households within a census tract with likelihood of lead-based paint (LBP) hazards from the age of housing (2017 California parcel data and 5-year estimates 2015-2019) combined with the percentage of households that are both low-income (household income less than 80% of the county median family income) and have children under 6 years old (5-year estimates 2013-2017).
indicator_comments: This indicator is specifically for small children based on the description of the calculation... Maybe this isn't best to include here.

interpretable_name: Potential risk for lead exposure from housing percentile
indicator_calculation_description: Data sourced from Cal Enviro Screen 4.0 (https://oehha.ca.gov/calenviroscreen/report/calenviroscreen-40). Percentage of households within a census tract with likelihood of lead-based paint (LBP) hazards from the age of housing (2017 California parcel data and 5-year estimates 2015-2019) combined with the percentage of households that are both low-income (household income less than 80% of the county median family income) and have children under 6 years old (5-year estimates 2013-2017). Percentile calculated relative to other census tracts.
indicator_comments: This indicator is specifically for small children based on the description of the calculation... Maybe this isn't best to include here.

indicator_calculation_description: Data sourced from Cal Enviro Screen 4.0 (https://oehha.ca.gov/calenviroscreen/report/calenviroscreen-40). Total pounds of 132 selected active pesticide ingredients (filtered for hazard and volatility) used in production-agriculture per square mile, averaged over three years (2017 to 2019). Based on pesticide use reported to California Department of Pesticide Regulation made publicly available for each Meridian-Township-Range-Section (MTRS) in California.
indicator_comments: Maybe we want to get real-time data from the DPR MTRS for our application here?

interpretable_name: Agricultural pesticide use percentile by census tract
indicator_calculation_description: Data sourced from Cal Enviro Screen 4.0 (https://oehha.ca.gov/calenviroscreen/report/calenviroscreen-40). Total pounds of 132 selected active pesticide ingredients (filtered for hazard and volatility) used in production-agriculture per square mile, averaged over three years (2017 to 2019). Based on pesticide use reported to California Department of Pesticide Regulation made publicly available for each Meridian-Township-Range-Section (MTRS) in California. Percentile calculated relative to other census tracts.
indicator_comments: Maybe we want to get real-time data from the DPR MTRS for our application here?

interpretable_name: Percentage housholds paying more than 50% income in rent
indicator_calculation_description: Data sourced from Cal Enviro Screen 4.0 (https://oehha.ca.gov/calenviroscreen/report/calenviroscreen-40). Percent of households in a census tract that are both low income (making less than 80% of the HUD Area Median Family Income) and severely burdened by housing costs (paying greater than 50% of their income to housing costs) based on American Community Survey, Comprehensive Housing Affordability Strategy (5-year estimates, 2013-2017).
indicator_comments: This might be a good indicator to include... Although it doesn't reflect pure price of housing by county.

interpretable_name: Percentage housholds paying more than 50% income in rent percentile by census tract
indicator_calculation_description: Data sourced from Cal Enviro Screen 4.0 (https://oehha.ca.gov/calenviroscreen/report/calenviroscreen-40). Percent of households in a census tract that are both low income (making less than 80% of the HUD Area Median Family Income) and severely burdened by housing costs (paying greater than 50% of their income to housing costs) based on American Community Survey, Comprehensive Housing Affordability Strategy (5-year estimates, 2013-2017). Percentile calculated relative to other census tracts.
indicator_comments: This might be a good indicator to include... Although it doesn't reflect pure price of housing by county.

interpretable_name:
Population-weighted percentage of the census tract area with tree
canopy
indicator_calculation_description: Data sourced from the Healthy Places Index (https://www.healthyplacesindex.org). Data based on satellite imagery of tree covereage from 2011, suppllied by the National Land Cover Database.
indicator_comments: We should keep either the CCHVI or this one -- they contain the same information, although the CHVI has a much more detailed description.

interpretable_name:
Population-weighted percentage of the census tract area with tree
canopy as a percentile by census tract
indicator_calculation_description: Data sourced from the Healthy Places Index (https://www.healthyplacesindex.org). Data based on satellite imagery of tree covereage from 2011, suppllied by the National Land Cover Database. Percentile calculated relative to other census tracts.
indicator_comments: We should keep either the CCHVI or this one -- they contain the same information, although the CHVI has a much more detailed description.

indicator_calculation_description: Data sourced from the Regional Opportunity Index (https://interact.regionalchange.ucdavis.edu/roi/data.html). Annual mean concentration of particles that are less than 2.5 micrometers in diameter computed and sampled by the Office of Environmental Health Hazard Assessment (2015-2017?). Percentiles calculated relative to other census tracts.
indicator_comments: This seems useful! But this data is old...

interpretable_name: PM2.5 z-score relative to other census tracts
indicator_calculation_description: Data sourced from the Regional Opportunity Index (https://interact.regionalchange.ucdavis.edu/roi/data.html). Annual mean concentration of particles that are less than 2.5 micrometers in diameter computed and sampled by the Office of Environmental Health Hazard Assessment 2015-2017?). Z-score calculated relative to other census tracts.
indicator_comments: Do we need a z-score for this?
